thread.title: Residential tower planned for West Philly 'Wash N Lube' car wash site
thread.title_full: Residential tower planned for West Philly 'Wash N Lube' car wash site

author: Jacob Adelman
title: Residential tower planned for West Philly 'Wash N Lube' car wash site
text:
Residential tower planned for West Philly 'Wash N Lube' car wash site Updated: February 22, 2017 — 6:01 PM EST 1 Share Jacob Adelman Staff Writer 
Jacob Adelman covers property deals, retail trends and the hospitality business as the commercial real estate reporter. More by Jacob Adelman Feb 21 
A 17-story residential tower is being proposed for the current site of the Chestnut Wash N Lube car wash at 4125 Chestnut St. in West Philadelphia. 
A developer identified as CRP Builders plans the 240-unit tower, which will also include 4,158 square feet of ground- and second-floor commercial space and 82 underground parking spots, according to plans posted Wednesday to the website of the city's Civic Design Review board. KCA Design Associates Artist's rendering of residential tower planned at 4125 Chestnut St. 
Architect Hyon Kang of KCA Design Associates LLC, listed as the project's applicant, did not immediately respond to a phone message seeking additional details. 
KCA's past projects have included townhouses, detached homes, shopping-center retail, and low-rise apartments, according to its website. 
The design-review board is scheduled to consider the proposal on March 7.
